polysaccharides, such as starch and glycogen, yielding glucose and
maltose. It is the major form of amylase found in humans and other
mammals. Voet, D., & Voet, J. G. (2005). Biochimie. (2e Ã©d.). Bruxelles: De
Boeck. 1583 p. It is also present in seeds containing starch as a food
reserve, and is secreted by many fungi.
